page.title: 03THE HARBOURMASTER
page.content: WE INTERVIEWED GEORGE COLVEN , WHO IS THE HARBOURMASTER IN ST ABBS . HE IS NEARLY 85 YEARS OLD . AND ONLY BECAME HARBOURMASTER WHEN HE RETIRED FROM FISHING 25 YEARS AGO . THERE ARE NOT MANY FISHING BOATS IN THE HARBOUR NOW , ONLY FOUR FULL_TIME FISHING AND PRAWN BOATS AND ANOTHER SIX WHICH CATCH LOBSTERS AND CRABS . GEORGE IS KEPT VERY BUSY IN SUMMER WITH THE DIVERS WHO USE THE HARBOUR WHEN DIVING IN THE NEARBY MARINE RESERVE . WHEN GEORGE WENT TO SEA AS A BOY THERE WERE OVER THIRTY BOATS SAILING OUT EVERY DAY FIFTY MILES OUT TO SEA . HE REMEMBERS THE NIGHT IN JANUARY 1907, WHEN "THE ALFRED ERLANDSEN" A DANISH STEAMSHIP WAS WRECKED ON THE ROCKS WITH THE LOSS OF ALL LIVES EXCEPT THAT OF A BLACK LABRADOR DOG . AS A RESULT OF THIS DISASTER FUNDS WERE RAISED TO PROVIDE A LIFEBOAT IN ST ABBS .
